result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel Booth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge within 6 months.  Failure to pay will result in tax intercept/civil judgment.   All non mandatory costs, fees were waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel Booth

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Nathaniel Booth.  Assistant District Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for the State of Wisconsin for Jessica Bellows.  State commented the Victim notification Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant was ordered to serve 1 day at the House of Correction with credit for 1 Day Time Served.  
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge within 6 months.  Failure to pay will result in tax intercept/civil judgment.   All non mandatory costs, fees were waived. 
mn

Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Kathryn Ginsberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaniel Booth appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea date.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 34, Judge Yamahiro. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 07-05-2022

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Defendant to comply with sex offender registry pursuant to 16CF31.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Nathaniel Booth in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-23-2022 @1:30p
